Summary Experienced and ingenious software / performance engineer with proven success in developing methodologies, creating solutions, as well as keeping up with technology trends. Demonstrated skills in problem solving, quickly identifying and satisfying customer needs, while specializing in hardware / software solution designs and implementations, performance / power characterization, tuning and analysis, as well as project management. Exceptional communicator able to connect with technical and non-technical customers both internally and externally. Experience Sr. Software Performance Engineer Intel Corporation 2004  –  2015  (11 years) Portland, Oregon Area Led engineering efforts of end-to-end performance/power optimization for Intel platforms and key Fortune 500 customer’s OS and applications software to ensure the delivery of best-of-class Intel server products. 
 
•	Optimized Intel server platform performance and energy efficiency through characterization and tuning using suite of Benchmarks led to optimized microcode algorithm designs and processor, memory and BIOS settings. 
 
•	Influenced future architecture design decisions through comprehensive technical assessments including CPU, memory and chip-set features. 
. 
•	Engaged with architecture, validation, BIOS/firmware, and software development teams, identified and drove to resolution of ACPI issues which caused unexpected CPU utilization and frequency behavior. 
 
•	Ensured best performance and stability of key customer’s OS and application software running on Intel platforms throughout the development cycles by load, stress, endurance, and regression tests, and performance optimizations. 
 
•	Achieved maximum transaction throughput for customer’s database software through profile-guided optimizations, as well as platform and storage tuning, using TPC-E and TPC-C benchmarks. 
 
•	Discovered and resolved performance regression issue for customer’s cloud service software due to memory and storage contentions during Primary server failure/recovery phase. 
 
•	Directed Automation Framework design and development initiative led to substantial improvement of measurement and data collection reliability and repeatability. 
 
•	Authored and delivered performance/power benchmarking presentations at Intel SSG Software Engineering Summits. Authored and served as instructor for Server Parallel Design courses. Performance Analyst Intel Corporation 2001  –  2004  (3 years) Portland, Oregon Area Performed performance characterization and future technology path-finding studies, as well as building/maintaining performance models for future product performance projections. 
 
•	Projected performance of future platforms through web based performance modeling. Contributed to building application and database based models through characterizing CPU, memory, bus and IO resulting in modeling efforts to be based on a wider scope of workloads. 
 
•	Influenced CPU micro-architecture design decision by evaluating future CPU inter-connect technology. Developed the link module (C/Unix), based on technology specification, integrated it into company’s architecture simulator, and ran instruction traces through simulator to assess and refine the new technology. 
 
•	Optimized Intel platforms and customer’s web server software performance using web workloads to ensure Intel products were the best choice in web server market. 
 
•	Defined and executed methodologies for exploring SSL acceleration opportunities and estimating potential benefits. Determined processor resources allocations among SSL operations and quantified minimum and maximum benefits of offloading SSL. 
 
•	Conducted study and developed analysis tools to characterize IPC network traffic and latency among database nodes in an Oracle 9i RAC cluster environment using Oracle Applications Standard Benchmark (OASB). Summary I’m a software design engineer with 21 years of industrial experience developing device drivers and middle layer systems software. I grew from a successful individual contributor to a technical lead, team lead/manager building highly effective software development team that created and shipped critical V1 products( KMDF, USB3) and sustained for couple of releases.  
 
I have 8 years of experience in building and leading two different teams (WDF, USB) to create a project plan by working closely with program managers, architects and develop the best technical design, and deliver on the commitments on schedule. My responsibilities include managing the engineering system, resources, bug management, staffing, mentoring, periodically reporting operational status to stakeholders, and employee performance management. 
 
Specialties: Windows OS internals, Windows device driver development for a broad spectrum of device technologies, working knowledge of various port-miniport/class-miniclass driver models, user and kernel debugging, architecture and software engineering, USB & network protocols, real-time and embedded systems, device driver consulting and training.
